thread.title: Sesame Street introduces new autistic character Julia
thread.title_full: Sesame Street introduces new autistic character Julia

author: Ben Travis
title: Sesame Street introduces new autistic character Julia
text:
Sesame Street introduces new autistic character Julia 
The new puppet will debut in April Monday 20 March 2017 10:21 GMT Click to followES Entertainment New addition: Julia (right) is Sesame Street's first autistic character HBO 
Sesame Street is bringing in a new character with autism to help educate children on the condition. 
The yellow-faced puppet Julia will debut on screen in April, having appeared in printed form in some Sesame Street storybooks. 
The character has been designed to embody some of the traits and behaviours that autistic children might display, including overactive excitement and difficulties in conversation. 
Julia will be puppeteered by Stacey Gordon, the mother of an autistic son. 

"Had my son's friends been exposed to his behaviours through something that they had seen on TV before they experienced them in the classroom, they might not have been frightened," she said on CBS News. 
"They might not have been worried when he cried. They would have known that he plays in a different way, and that that's OK." (Zach Hyman/Sesame Workshop via AP) 
Show writer Christine Ferraro told CBS News: "The big discussion right at the start was, 'How do we do this? How do we talk about autism?' One Direction on the set of Sesame Street One Direction on the set of Sesame Street 1/3 Biggest Fan 
One Direction pose with their number one fan Big Bird from Sesame Street (picture by Twitter/Sesame Street) 2/3 What Makes U Beautiful 
One Direction visit Sesame Street to learn their ABCs (picture by Sesame workshop) 3/3 Sing-a-long 
Liam Payne and Harry Styles audition Bert for a place in the band (picture by Sesame workshop) 
"It's tricky because autism is not one thing, because it is different for every single person who has autism. Read more
